text:
“Let me go,” Dounia said, her voice sharp. 

“Where are you going?” 

“To him. Where is he?” 

“Why is this door locked?” 

“We can’t shout about this,” Svidrigaïlov replied, weary. 

“Do you want to betray him?” 

“Wait. He can still be saved.” 

“Can he really?” 

Dounia sat down, anxious. 

“It all depends on you,” he whispered, eyes bright. 

She recoiled, fear creeping in. 

“One word from you, and he is saved. I have money. I’ll get passports. I’ll help him.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Dounia is urged to consider her influence over her brother's fate, as Svidrigaïlov believes she can help save him from his dire situation.
